newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria partly sells two T-bill issues.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria partly sells two T-bill issues.

text.p: Bulgaria's Finance Ministry offers of two issues of T-bills, both dated September 11, were only partly sold on Monday, yielding 243.44 percent and 212.70 percent, respectively, the central bank (BNB) said.
A six-month floater coupon T-bill issue was 17.16 percent sold as eight financial institutions took part in the auction.
The issue was offered with no minimum acceptable price set in advance, and its coupon equals the BNB's central interest rate (CIR), now 108 percent, for the period to maturity.
An issue of 29-day discount T-bills was only 6.96 percent sold with five financial instituitions taking part in the auction.
Details of the issues follow:
Issue number BG3017396022 BG3017496006
Type Floater coupon Discount
Par value 3.5 bln levs 2.0 bln levs
Auction date Sept 9, 1996 Sept 9, 1996
Issue date Sept 11, 1996 Sept 11, 1996
Maturity date Mar 12, 1997 Oct 10, 1996
Bids received 600.44 million levs 139.23 million levs
Avg price of bids 83.16 pct 91.34 pct
Bids approved 600.44 million levs 139.23 million levs
Avg accepted price 83.16 pct 91.34 pct
Yield to maturity 85.01 pct 9.48 pct
Cumulative annual yield 243.44 pct 212.70 pct
The finance minstry might use the 626.5 million levs raised at the two auctions for today's maturity payments on earlier issues, a ministry official who declined to be named told Reuters.
Two six-month T-bill issues with a total par value of 2.177 billion levs mature on September 11, BNB data shows.
The first is a discount one with a par of 376.77 million levs and the other is a floater coupon issue with a par of 1.8 billion levs and a coupon set at five points over the CIR.
-- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
